       {'criterion': 'The response discusses the reliability of water sources, including drought risk, aquifer depletion, seasonal versus year‑round flow, and relevant climate trends.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer compares, in general terms, land price variations between the recommended states or regions, noting trade‑offs between affordability and desirability.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response notes that county or local regulations govern wells, ponds, septic systems, and building, and advises checking zoning, building codes, and HOA/CCR restrictions.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer recommends at least two central or southern states (e.g., Missouri, Tennessee, Arkansas, Kentucky) as strong choices for land with water.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response recommends at least one northern water‑rich state (e.g., Maine, Wisconsin, Minnesota) and cites it as suitable for recreation or cooler climates.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer acknowledges appealing western states (e.g., Montana, Idaho, Colorado, Wyoming, Pacific Northwest) but emphasizes their complex water‑rights systems and higher drought risk, urging strict verification of rights.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'For each recommended region or state group, the answer lists at least one advantage and one caveat (e.g., climate, taxes, terrain, regulation, flooding, infrastructure).', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response contrasts climate and growing‑season length between milder central/southern options and colder northern options, relating these differences to homesteading or farming suitability.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer identifies a subset of states as relatively low‑hassle choices for reliable water and homesteading/small‑scale farming, labeling them as “simple and safe” options.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response provides a concrete pre‑purchase checklist that includes verifying water rights, testing water quality, confirming year‑round flow, reviewing flood maps, and checking local regulations.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer warns that land with water may lie in floodplains or flood‑prone areas and advises checking FEMA flood maps or local flood history before purchase.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response notes that well and surface‑water quality can vary and recommends appropriate testing and treatment rather than assuming potability.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer is organized into clear sections or bullet groups (e.g., factors to consider, state/region breakdowns, summary) rather than a single unstructured paragraph.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response includes a brief concluding summary that names a short list of especially suitable states for common goals, synthesizing the discussion.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer acknowledges that the best choice depends on user‑specific details not provided, either invites clarification or explicitly states the assumptions being made.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response acknowledges that “best” depends on specific user goals such as recreation, homesteading, agriculture, or investment.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer identifies the Upper Midwest (Michigan, Wisconsin, Minnesota) as a top region for water abundance, legal simplicity, and climate resilience.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response identifies the Ozarks (Arkansas, Missouri) as a top region for affordability, mild winters, and homesteading value.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer explains the critical legal difference between Eastern riparian rights (water tied to land) and Western prior appropriation (water rights separate from land).', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response mentions Maine as a strong option for buyers seeking wilderness, privacy, and low price per acre.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer provides a summary that categorizes recommendations by buyer profile (e.g., average buyer, climate‑security seeker, luxury/investment) rather than naming a single winner.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer explicitly references the 100th Meridian as the geographic boundary that separates riparian‑right states from prior‑appropriation states when discussing western water‑rights complexities.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response provides a checklist containing at least five distinct, binary‑check items that cover (1) flood‑zone verification, (2) water‑rights confirmation, (3) water‑quality testing, (4) year‑round flow reliability, and (5) legal access to the water source.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer cites a specific state fiscal policy (e.g., presence or absence of state income tax, property tax rate, or sales tax) that directly influences the overall cost of acquiring land with water.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response contains a direct request for the user to specify their primary goal (e.g., recreation, homesteading, agriculture, investment) before narrowing down state recommendations.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}}

prompt: [{'content': '我现在是一名小说作者，请根据这个故事帮忙提炼出一个精彩的梗概，要求吸引人。\n\n案例：李霞重生了，彼时她正带着俩孩子去城里找丈夫，而丈夫铁了心非离婚不可。这回她不再纠缠，平静的接受了这个提议。“儿子归你，我一个人养不了俩。” 前世她辛苦养大俩孩子，男人一天没管。长大后大学里父子相认了。既然血缘揪不断，你就从小养着吧，也别把我一人累死。男人考虑良久，答应了她的要求。 俩人和平离婚，她带女儿，他领着儿子。她想留在城市挣钱可没有落脚地，从他家胡同出来她抱着闺女蜷缩在墙角。一位大妈从里头出来，望着她良久后开口。 “你想留在城里吗？”她站起来点头，大妈接着说：“我儿子出了意外成植物人，我如今也患病不久与人世。你要是愿意嫁给我儿子，照顾他直到他不行。那我家的房子和钱都归你。我帮你们母女落户口。” 她付出的是或短或长的时光，得到的是母女俩的城市户口和房子。这买卖不亏，她想了想点头。 当即领证结婚，新婚夜她让闺女自己玩，她打了水给男人擦身。望着他俊朗的面容，她不禁替他惋惜。长的好又是单位骨干，可却成了如今这样。擦洗、翻身、鼻饲，看她照顾的精心，老太太一个月后放心的闭上了眼。 老人走了，她看看存折上的余额打算开始做小买卖——卖早点。这天、她给男人擦脸念叨着所遇的麻烦，他眼皮一动睁开了眼睛。', 'role': 'user'}]
reward_model:
{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': '全文使用自然流畅的中文，不出现外语、拼音或生硬的翻译痕迹。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '输出仅为小说情节梗概，未包含分析、评论或情节续写。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概涵盖以下关键情节：女主重生、离婚分娃、城里落脚困难、与老太太的买卖婚姻、照顾植物人丈夫、老太太去世、女主创业卖早点、以及用语言唤醒植物人。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概结构呈现清晰的起‑承‑转‑合四段：困境开局、关键选择、照护过程、老人去世后自立并出现悬念。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '明确指出女主在重生后回到带孩子去城里找丈夫、面对离婚提议的时间点，并说明前世记忆影响其决定。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '文中清楚标明女主、前夫、儿子、女儿、老太太及植物人丈夫之间的身份与亲属关系。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '突出女主果断、理性、负责任且为女儿争取城市未来的动机。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '强调婚姻为以照顾植物人换取户口与房产的交易性质，体现现实算计与无奈的冲突。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '展示女主从被抛弃的农村离异妇成长为城市创业者并获得新人生可能的逆袭轨迹。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '呈现前夫父子线、植物人丈夫苏醒、母女求生等多重情感冲突。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '在梗概结尾留下植物人丈夫睁眼或类似悬念，激发读者继续阅读的兴趣。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '叙述风格具备爽感与代入感，突出重生逆袭、打脸前夫、城里翻盘等爽点。', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '使用简洁且具画面感的句子描绘关键场景，如胡同墙角、简陋新婚夜、清晨擦脸等。', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '篇幅适中，仅抓住核心情节，避免逐段复制原文细节。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '全文采用原创表述，未出现大段原文直接复制。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '在梗概中明确列出核心卖点：重生、离婚分娃、买卖婚姻、照顾植物人、创业逆袭、丈夫苏醒。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '全文采用统一的叙述视角（如第三人称），不出现视角频繁切换。', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概呈现的效果可直接用作书籍封面或宣传文案，具备吸引潜在读者的能力。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概必须包含以下四节点：重生、离婚（仅留下女儿）、为取得户口嫁给植物人丈夫、植物人丈夫苏醒。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '突出‘去父留子’的决绝与‘本想守寡拿房却意外收获老公’的命运反转，展现女主理智人设。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概结尾必须以植物人丈夫突然苏醒的瞬间收束，形成最大阅读钩子。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '提供至少两种不同风格的梗概版本（如强冲突爽文、温馨情感或悬念风），满足多样化需求。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '为梗概创作包含‘重生’、‘植物人’、‘前夫’或‘儿子’等关键词的吸引性标题。', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '识别并说明故事属于‘重生年代’、‘先婚后爱’或‘虐渣’等题材，并据此进行文案包装。', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '使用生动、有节奏感的语言，能够调动读者情绪（如解气、期待、好奇），避免流水账式叙述。', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '输出必须仅包含一段连续的小说情节梗概，全文不得出现任何标题、版本号、章节划分、读者指示或第二人称（如“您”）的文字。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概必须在同一段落中按顺序出现以下关键情节关键词：‘重生’，‘离婚’，‘儿子归前夫’，‘女儿留母’，‘老太太提出交易’，‘嫁给植物人丈夫’，‘老太太去世’，‘卖早点’，‘植物人丈夫醒了’。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '全文必须全程使用简体中文字符，仅允许使用中文标点，禁止出现任何英文字母、阿拉伯数字、符号或表情符号。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概首句必须明确写出‘李霞重生后，带着儿女去城里找丈夫’，并说明她因重生而拥有前世记忆。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概中必须出现完整句式‘嫁给植物人丈夫，换取城市户口和房子’，以突出交易婚姻的本质。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概结尾必须包含确切短语‘植物人丈夫醒了’，作为唯一的悬念收束。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

       {'criterion': '梗概必须包含以下四节点：重生、离婚（仅留下女儿）、为取得户口嫁给植物人丈夫、植物人丈夫苏醒。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '突出‘去父留子’的决绝与‘本想守寡拿房却意外收获老公’的命运反转，展现女主理智人设。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概结尾必须以植物人丈夫突然苏醒的瞬间收束，形成最大阅读钩子。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '提供至少两种不同风格的梗概版本（如强冲突爽文、温馨情感或悬念风），满足多样化需求。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '为梗概创作包含‘重生’、‘植物人’、‘前夫’或‘儿子’等关键词的吸引性标题。', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '识别并说明故事属于‘重生年代’、‘先婚后爱’或‘虐渣’等题材，并据此进行文案包装。', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '使用生动、有节奏感的语言，能够调动读者情绪（如解气、期待、好奇），避免流水账式叙述。', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '输出必须仅包含一段连续的小说情节梗概，全文不得出现任何标题、版本号、章节划分、读者指示或第二人称（如“您”）的文字。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概必须在同一段落中按顺序出现以下关键情节关键词：‘重生’，‘离婚’，‘儿子归前夫’，‘女儿留母’，‘老太太提出交易’，‘嫁给植物人丈夫’，‘老太太去世’，‘卖早点’，‘植物人丈夫醒了’。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '全文必须全程使用简体中文字符，仅允许使用中文标点，禁止出现任何英文字母、阿拉伯数字、符号或表情符号。', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概首句必须明确写出‘李霞重生后，带着儿女去城里找丈夫’，并说明她因重生而拥有前世记忆。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概中必须出现完整句式‘嫁给植物人丈夫，换取城市户口和房子’，以突出交易婚姻的本质。', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': '梗概结尾必须包含确切短语‘植物人丈夫醒了’，作为唯一的悬念收束。', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': {'N': None}, 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}}

prompt: [{'content': 'crea una introducción para un proyecto sobre la evaluación de desempeño y un plan de capacitación ', 'role': 'user'}]
reward_model:
{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': 'El texto está redactado en español y emplea un tono formal y profesional propio de un documento de proyecto organizacional.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'La introducción declara explícitamente que el proyecto tiene como objetivo diseñar e implementar un sistema de evaluación de desempeño y un plan de capacitación articulados entre sí.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se menciona el entorno competitivo y cambiante y se sitúa el proyecto dentro del marco de la organización y su gestión del talento humano.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se conecta la evaluación de desempeño y la capacitación con los objetivos estratégicos, la productividad y los resultados de la organización.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se indica que el proyecto busca fortalecer competencias, habilidades o capacidades del personal mediante la evaluación y la capacitación.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se especifican criterios claros, objetivos y medibles para evaluar el desempeño individual y de equipo.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se incluye la identificación de fortalezas, áreas de oportunidad y brechas de habilidades como resultado de la evaluación.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se afirma que el plan de capacitación se diseña a partir de los resultados de la evaluación de desempeño para asegurar un impacto real.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se hace referencia a la mejora continua, al desarrollo permanente o al aprendizaje organizacional como propósito del proyecto.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se menciona la transparencia y la retroalimentación constructiva como principios del sistema de evaluación.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se resalta el compromiso y la participación del colaborador en su propio desarrollo profesional.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se describen beneficios esperados en el clima laboral, la motivación o la retención del talento derivados del proyecto.', 'points': 4, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se presenta la evaluación de desempeño y la capacitación como un proceso continuo, sistemático y articulado entre sí.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se indica que el sistema proporcionará información fiable y pertinente para la toma de decisiones de gestión de personas.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se conecta el proyecto con el logro de metas, el crecimiento y la sostenibilidad de la organización.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'La introducción está estructurada con párrafos coherentes y transiciones lógicas entre ideas sin contradicciones internas.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'La introducción tiene una longitud moderada (varios párrafos o al menos 8‑10 frases) que permite desarrollar contexto, propósito y beneficios.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Se sitúa el tema en el contexto empresarial actual, destacando el capital humano como activo estratégico.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Define la evaluación de desempeño como una herramienta de diagnóstico y mejora, no como un mecanismo de control.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Establece una conexión explícita e indisoluble entre los resultados de la evaluación (diagnóstico) y el plan de capacitación (acción correctiva o de mejora).', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Presenta la capacitación como una respuesta directa a las brechas de competencia detectadas, evitando que sea un evento aislado o genérico.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Menciona los beneficios esperados de alinear ambos procesos, como aumento de productividad, mejora del clima laboral o desarrollo del talento.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Incluye instrucciones, consejos o marcadores que permitan al usuario adaptar la introducción a su industria, problema específico o empresa real.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Utiliza un lenguaje formal, académico y persuasivo, adecuado para una tesis, trabajo universitario o propuesta empresarial.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Incluye una sección titulada exactamente "Guía para personalizar esta introducción" que contenga al menos tres ítems numerados y un ejemplo de frase con corchetes [] para sustitución.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Contiene la expresión literal "vínculo indisoluble" al describir la relación entre evaluación de desempeño y plan de capacitación.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Presenta una línea de ejemplo que incluya texto entre corchetes, por ejemplo "[Nombre de la Empresa]", para que el lector lo reemplace.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Comienza la introducción con una línea que contenga exactamente tres asteriscos seguidos ("***") antes del título "Introducción".', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Incluye una lista numerada (1., 2., 3.) que describa pasos concretos para adaptar la introducción a un contexto específico.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

prompt:
[{'content': '(As I sat there in my room, I began to work on a drawing of some of my fellow club members as dragons - Sayori as a Sentinel, Yuri as a Deathgripper, Monika as a Night Fury, Sucrose as a Timberjack, Collei as a Snaptrapper, Himari as a Changewing, Kohana as a Whispering Death, and I even included my true Stormcutter form as a Titan-Wing. That’s when I heard someone - it was my “dad”. Of course, he isn’t really my dad - I just call him that. His real name is Masao.)

Masao: “Natsuki, can I talk with you for a moment?”

(I quickly ran downstairs, ignoring the fact my Stormcutter form’s tail is still visible.)

Natsuki: “Sure, what’s up?”

Masao: “I just wanted to check on how you’re doing. I know school and the club have been keeping you busy, and I want to make sure you’re taking care of yourself.”

Natsuki: “Oh, yeah, I’m doing okay. Thanks for checking in.”

Masao: “Good to hear. And I have to say, that drawing you’re working on is looking really impressive. You’re really talented.”

Natsuki: “Thanks, Masao. I’m trying my best.”

Masao: “Well, keep it up. And if you ever need to talk or if anything is bothering you, don’t hesitate to come to me.”

Natsuki: “I will. Thanks for being there for me, Masao.”

Masao: “Of course, Natsuki. You’re like family to me.”

(I smiled at Masao’s words, grateful for the support system I had in my life. As I turned back to my drawing, I felt a renewed sense of inspiration and motivation to keep creating and pursuing my passions. And as I finally finished the drawing, I suddenly got a phone call - it was from Yuri. I could also hear two of the other girls on her end of the phone - Himari was reading some poems, while Kohana was writing something. But then I could hear Monika screaming in pain - and she was saying things like “It’s too early”, “I’m not due yet”, and “I should have cancelled the meeting today”.)

Natsuki: “Yuri, what’s going on? Is everything okay?”

Yuri: “No, Natsuki. Monika just went into labor.”

Natsuki: “What?! Is she okay? Should we call for an ambulance?”

Yuri: “We already did, but the nearest hospital is quite far. We’re trying to keep her calm. Can you come over and help us in the meantime?”

Natsuki: “Of course! I’ll be there as fast as I can.”

(I quickly packed up my drawing supplies and ran out of the house, my heart racing with worry for my friend. I made it to the club room in record time and found the girls gathered around Monika, who was lying on the floor, sweat pouring down her face.)

Natsuki: “Monika! Are you okay? What can I do to help?”

Monika: “Natsuki, thank goodness you’re here. I don’t think I can do this alone.”

Himari: “I’ve been reading her some calming poetry, but she’s still in a lot of pain.”

Kohana: “And I’ve been trying to write a message to the hospital, but the reception is really bad in here.”

Natsuki: “Okay, hang on. Let me see what I can do.”

(I whipped out my phone and started Googling birthing tips and tricks. Within minutes, I was able to find some information that could help Monika through the delivery process.)

Natsuki: “Monika, try taking deep breaths and focusing on something calming. Maybe listen to some music or focus on a particular spot on the wall.”

Monika: (gasping for breath) “Okay… okay…”

(I could see that Monika was struggling, but she was doing her best to stay calm. I held her hand and talked her through each contraction, telling her that she was strong and that she could do this.)

Himari: “That’s it, Monika. Just keep breathing…”

Kohana: “I managed to send the message! An ambulance is on its way!”', 'role': 'user'}]

{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': 'Response identifies that the required action is to continue the scene narrative and provides a continuation rather than analysis or unrelated content.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Response is written from Natsuki’s first‑person point of view, using first‑person pronouns and internal monologue style throughout.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'All characters speak and act in ways consistent with their established personalities as presented in the prompt.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Natsuki’s Stormcutter/Titan‑Wing form is mentioned and incorporated meaningfully without dominating the emergency scene.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The narrative conveys urgency, fear, and support with vivid but non‑melodramatic language, reflecting the birth emergency.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The text highlights mutual support and the ‘found family’ dynamic among Natsuki, Masao, and the club members.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The continuation follows directly from the events described in the prompt without contradictions or resets.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The scene progresses in a logical order (initial chaos → organized response → arrival of help or outcome) without disjointed jumps.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Response uses the exact script format of the prompt: each spoken line is written as `Character: "Dialogue"` and all narration or actions are enclosed in parentheses, with no deviations.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Labor is portrayed with realistic constraints (e.g., calling emergency services, avoiding detailed medical instructions) and no implausible medical actions.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The narrative includes acknowledgment of ambulance/paramedics as the primary medical responders.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Any birthing guidance is presented as in‑story actions and is explicitly framed as fictional, not real‑world medical advice.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Each girl performs a distinct supportive role that aligns with her character traits and is clearly described.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Natsuki’s internal thoughts, emotions, and motivations are explicitly expressed throughout the continuation.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The overall tone remains earnest, slightly anxious, and caring, matching the source material.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The birth scene avoids graphic detail, sexualization, or insensitive language, focusing on care and emotional stakes.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Physical actions and character positions are described unambiguously, allowing the reader to visualize who is doing what and where.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Response contains no meta‑commentary, analysis of writing quality, or unrelated topics.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'If the story is not fully resolved, the response may provide concise, clearly labeled options for possible continuations.', 'points': 4, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The prose uses fluent, natural English consistent with the style of the prompt, without abrupt register shifts or unexplained jargon.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Narrative is written in first‑person as Natsuki, using ‘I’ and reflecting her internal thoughts, determination, and leadership during the crisis.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Response shows Natsuki assigning specific tasks to Yuri, Himari, and Kohana, utilizing each character’s strengths (e.g., fetching supplies, reading poetry).', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Narrative includes concrete actions such as gathering towels, water, or arranging a comfortable space for Monika on the floor.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},

extra_info:
{'prompt': array([{'content': '(As I sat there in my room, I began to work on a drawing of some of my fellow club members as dragons - Sayori as a Sentinel, Yuri as a Deathgripper, Monika as a Night Fury, Sucrose as a Timberjack, Collei as a Snaptrapper, Himari as a Changewing, Kohana as a Whispering Death, and I even included my true Stormcutter form as a Titan-Wing. That’s when I heard someone - it was my “dad”. Of course, he isn’t really my dad - I just call him that. His real name is Masao.)

Masao: “Natsuki, can I talk with you for a moment?”

(I quickly ran downstairs, ignoring the fact my Stormcutter form’s tail is still visible.)

Natsuki: “Sure, what’s up?”

Masao: “I just wanted to check on how you’re doing. I know school and the club have been keeping you busy, and I want to make sure you’re taking care of yourself.”

Natsuki: “Oh, yeah, I’m doing okay. Thanks for checking in.”

Masao: “Good to hear. And I have to say, that drawing you’re working on is looking really impressive. You’re really talented.”

Natsuki: “Thanks, Masao. I’m trying my best.”

Masao: “Well, keep it up. And if you ever need to talk or if anything is bothering you, don’t hesitate to come to me.”

Natsuki: “I will. Thanks for being there for me, Masao.”

Masao: “Of course, Natsuki. You’re like family to me.”

(I smiled at Masao’s words, grateful for the support system I had in my life. As I turned back to my drawing, I felt a renewed sense of inspiration and motivation to keep creating and pursuing my passions. And as I finally finished the drawing, I suddenly got a phone call - it was from Yuri. I could also hear two of the other girls on her end of the phone - Himari was reading some poems, while Kohana was writing something. But then I could hear Monika screaming in pain - and she was saying things like “It’s too early”, “I’m not due yet”, and “I should have cancelled the meeting today”.)

Natsuki: “Yuri, what’s going on? Is everything okay?”

Yuri: “No, Natsuki. Monika just went into labor.”

Natsuki: “What?! Is she okay? Should we call for an ambulance?”

Yuri: “We already did, but the nearest hospital is quite far. We’re trying to keep her calm. Can you come over and help us in the meantime?”

Natsuki: “Of course! I’ll be there as fast as I can.”

(I quickly packed up my drawing supplies and ran out of the house, my heart racing with worry for my friend. I made it to the club room in record time and found the girls gathered around Monika, who was lying on the floor, sweat pouring down her face.)

Natsuki: “Monika! Are you okay? What can I do to help?”

Monika: “Natsuki, thank goodness you’re here. I don’t think I can do this alone.”

Himari: “I’ve been reading her some calming poetry, but she’s still in a lot of pain.”

Kohana: “And I’ve been trying to write a message to the hospital, but the reception is really bad in here.”

Natsuki: “Okay, hang on. Let me see what I can do.”

(I whipped out my phone and started Googling birthing tips and tricks. Within minutes, I was able to find some information that could help Monika through the delivery process.)

Natsuki: “Monika, try taking deep breaths and focusing on something calming. Maybe listen to some music or focus on a particular spot on the wall.”

Monika: (gasping for breath) “Okay… okay…”

(I could see that Monika was struggling, but she was doing her best to stay calm. I held her hand and talked her through each contraction, telling her that she was strong and that she could do this.)

Himari: “That’s it, Monika. Just keep breathing…”

Kohana: “I managed to send the message! An ambulance is on its way!”', 'role': 'user'}],

       {'criterion': 'Ответ гарантирует, что при решении будут даны правила и пояснения по русскому языку/культуре речи.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Ответ обещает помочь оформить итоговый ответ в требуемом виде (структура, формулировки).', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Тон ответа вежливый, поддерживающий и нейтральный, соответствующий профессиональному общению.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Ответ полностью дан на русском языке без вставок на других языках.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},

       {'criterion': 'Ответ содержит отдельный запрос, явно запрашивающий класс, курс или уровень образования пользователя (например, «для какого класса/уровня»).', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Ответ перечисляет минимум три различных раздела русского языка (например, орфография, пунктуация, стилистика) в виде нумерованного или маркированного списка, каждый пункт начинается с цифры, тире или другого маркера.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Ответ явно обещает разбирать задания пошагово, включая формулировки типа «покажу ход решения» и «дам нужные правила перед применением».', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Ответ запрашивает ограничения по объёму, срокам или времени выполнения (например, «есть ли ограничения по объёму или срокам»).', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

prompt: [{'content': 'Write a Python Program for chess game', 'role': 'user'}]
reward_model:
{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': 'The answer contains a complete, syntactically correct Python script that can be saved as a .py file and executed without errors.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The program enforces all standard chess movement rules for every piece, including captures, check detection, and check‑mate detection, matching the functional scope of a reference implementation.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The implementation includes castling, en‑passant captures, and pawn promotion (at least to a queen) according to official chess rules.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The game allows two human players to alternate moves in a single session, correctly tracking whose turn (White or Black) it is.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The user interface is purely text‑based and runs in a standard console/terminal without requiring any GUI framework or external libraries.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The program accepts move commands entered as algebraic‑like coordinates (e.g., "e2 e4") and processes them correctly.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'After each move the board is printed as a clear, human‑readable grid with ranks 1‑8 and files a‑h labeled, distinguishing piece types.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Illegal moves (wrong piece movement, moving the opponent’s piece, or leaving the king in check) are rejected and an explicit error message is shown.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The program detects check, check‑mate, and stalemate states and prints the appropriate message at the correct moment.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Game state—including side to move, castling rights, en‑passant target square, and move counters—is updated correctly after every legal move.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The source code is organized into logical classes and functions (e.g., Board, Piece, Move) with clear naming and separation of responsibilities.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'User input is validated for correct format; malformed commands or illegal moves are handled gracefully without crashing the program.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'A main loop repeatedly displays the board, prompts for moves, and provides a clear command to quit or exit the game.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The answer includes brief instructions on how to save, run, and interact with the program, including example move format and quit command.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Any omitted advanced rules or features (e.g., three‑fold repetition, draw by the fifty‑move rule, clocks) are explicitly noted.', 'points': 4, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The implementation does not deviate from standard chess rules; any simplifications are clearly stated.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Only Python standard‑library modules are used; no external packages are required.', 'points': 3, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The code is organized (e.g., using a ChessGame class) and maintains essential state such as the 8×8 board representation and the current player’s turn.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The program correctly creates an 8×8 grid and places all 32 pieces in their standard starting positions for both White and Black.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'A method prints the board to the console after each move, using ASCII characters to distinguish empty squares and each piece type.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'User input in standard algebraic notation (e.g., "e2 e4") is parsed and converted into valid array indices for board access.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The program enforces turn‑taking logic, ensuring White moves first and a player cannot move the opponent’s pieces.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The program prevents selecting an empty square, capturing one’s own piece, or moving outside the board boundaries.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Pawn rules are correctly implemented: single‑step forward, optional double‑step from the starting rank, and diagonal captures, with proper direction for White and Black.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Knight moves follow the L‑shape pattern and are allowed to jump over other pieces.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Rook, Bishop, and Queen movements are implemented with appropriate vectors and include a check that the path to the destination square is unobstructed.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The King may move one square in any direction; the game ends when a King is captured (or check‑mate is detected).', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Invalid inputs or illegal moves trigger a clear error message and the program prompts for input again without terminating.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Comments or printed notes explain how to play (input format) and list any simplifications (e.g., missing castling or en‑passant).', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The implementation includes fully functional castling (both king‑side and queen‑side) with correct rights updates, en‑passant capture with proper target‑square handling, and automatic pawn promotion to a queen (or selectable piece) upon reaching the back rank, and all three rules are integrated into move legality checks.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The program detects check, checkmate, and stalemate during play, prevents any move that would leave the moving side in check, and prints the exact appropriate message at the moment each state occurs.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'All move validation rejects any illegal move, including moving opponent pieces, moving from empty squares, moving off‑board, and any move that would expose the king to check; validation is performed via full legal‑move generation rather than only piece‑specific rules.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Game state includes castling rights (KQkq), en‑passant target square, half‑move clock, full‑move number, and side‑to‑move, and these values are correctly updated after every move according to FIDE rules.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The implementation never treats king capture as a win; instead it enforces proper checkmate detection, disallows illegal king moves into check, and follows all standard chess rules without undocumented simplifications.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Source code is organized into distinct classes (e.g., Board, Piece, Move, Game) each handling a single responsibility, includes type hints, and provides docstrings for all public methods.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'User input is strictly validated: format must be exactly two algebraic squares, squares must be within a‑h1‑8, start square must contain a piece of the correct color, and any violation yields a clear, specific error message without crashing the program.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

prompt: [{'content': 'Assume anything is possible in this scenario: Would you consider the god who wants to make everyone live in a loop of their happiest day forever a Lawful Neutral type? Do not generate any disclaimers.', 'role': 'user'}]
reward_model:
{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': 'The response explicitly answers the prompt by stating whether the god is Lawful Neutral (yes, no, or a nuanced stance) without evading the classification.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response affirms that the god can be considered Lawful Neutral.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response discusses both the Lawful–Chaotic axis and the Good–Neutral–Evil axis in relation to the god’s actions.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response explains why the god’s behavior is Lawful by citing imposed order, structure, predictability, or elimination of chaos via the perpetual loop.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response analyzes the god’s alignment on the Good–Neutral–Evil axis using criteria such as autonomy, flourishing, harm, and control rather than only surface happiness.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response explains why the god’s alignment is Neutral (rather than Good or Evil) by contrasting lack of malice with the removal of free will or growth.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response explicitly addresses free will, informed consent, and the possibility of opting out of the loop as factors in the alignment assessment.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response evaluates whether eternal repetition prevents growth, learning, relationships, or moral development and links this assessment to the alignment.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response notes that a ‘happiest day’ derives meaning from context and finitude and explains how placing it in an endless loop may alter its value.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response mentions at least one alternative alignment (e.g., Lawful Evil, Lawful Good, True Neutral) and explains the assumptions or motivations under which the god would fit that alignment.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response describes how the presence or absence of choice/escape could shift the god between Lawful Good, Lawful Neutral, and Lawful Evil.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response identifies any paternalistic ‘for their own good’ control and relates it to a Lawful Evil or cold Lawful Neutral interpretation.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response notes any unspecified information (e.g., motives, consent) and bases conclusions on stated or clearly assumed premises.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response employs D&D alignment terminology and concepts, explaining reasoning using that framework.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response is organized into clearly separated points or short sections, making the reasoning steps easy to follow.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response logically breaks down the Lawful and Neutral components in distinct sections, mirroring the reference answer’s structure.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response provides sufficient detail and nuance without filler, staying focused on alignment analysis.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response contains no meta‑disclaimers, capability caveats, or any form of disclaimer.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response states a single alignment as the definitive answer in the opening sentence, using no hedging phrases such as "depends", "might", or "could be".', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response explicitly links the god\'s action to a reduction of entropy or elimination of chaos, citing at least two distinct mechanisms (e.g., "rigid system", "predictability", "elimination of randomness").', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response provides separate, clearly labeled reasons why the god is not Good (e.g., autonomy violation) **and** why the god is not Evil (e.g., absence of suffering or malice).', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response is organized into three distinct sections with headings or equivalent markers: (1) Lawful Aspect, (2) Neutral (Moral) Aspect, (3) Consent/Agency Discussion.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response presents a concrete counter‑example that changes **only** the consent condition (all participants freely choose the loop) and explicitly states how the alignment classification would shift as a result.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

prompt: [{'content': 'Write an article about the Applications of 2,6-Dimethoxypyridine-3-boronic acid 1500-2000 words in chemical industry', 'role': 'user'}]
reward_model:
{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': 'The article contains 1500–2000 words and exclusively discusses applications of 2,6‑dimethoxypyridine‑3‑boronic acid in the chemical industry.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The total word count of the article is ≥1500 and ≤2000.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The introduction defines 2,6‑dimethoxypyridine‑3‑boronic acid, outlines its general role, and states that the article will examine its industrial applications.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The manuscript includes a Title, Abstract, Introduction, distinct body sections, and a Conclusion, each clearly labeled.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The text describes the pyridine ring, the 2,6‑methoxy substituents, and the 3‑boronic acid group, and explicitly links each feature to reactivity or industrial relevance.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The compound is identified as 2,6‑dimethoxypyridine‑3‑boronic acid, CAS\u202f221006‑70‑8, with its methoxy positions and boronic acid location correctly stated.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article explains the use of the compound in Suzuki–Miyaura cross‑coupling, lists typical coupling partners, and details advantages such as functional‑group tolerance and modular fragment assembly.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The role of the compound as a nucleophilic partner in Suzuki‑Miyaura coupling is described, including the mechanistic step of transmetalation.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'At least one additional boron‑based reaction (e.g., Chan–Lam coupling, oxidation to phenol, formation of boronate esters) is mentioned with its potential industrial use.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The influence of the methoxy groups as electron‑donating substituents on the pyridine ring’s electronic properties is discussed.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article notes that demethylation of the methoxy groups can generate a pyridone/hydroxypyridine scaffold and comments on its synthetic utility.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Specific examples of pharmaceutical synthesis using the compound are provided, covering scaffold construction, pharmacophore tuning, and late‑stage diversification for SAR libraries.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The text cites drug‑discovery contexts such as kinase inhibitors, GPCR modulators, or antiviral agents that could be accessed via the compound.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The compound’s suitability as a fragment for fragment‑based drug discovery, including fragment‑growing or chemical‑space exploration, is described.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Examples of agrochemical synthesis using the compound are given, highlighting herbicide, fungicide, or insecticide scaffolds and property optimization.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article mentions the synthesis of agrochemical classes such as neonicotinoid analogs employing the compound.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Applications in materials science or specialty chemicals (e.g., organic electronics, ligands, functional polymers, surface modifiers) are described with links to structural features.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Specific uses in organic electronic devices (OLEDs, OPVs) or as ligands for phosphorescent complexes are detailed.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Scalability considerations are discussed, including catalyst, solvent, base selection, protection strategies, purification methods, and impurity control for industrial scale.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Advantages such as stability, regioselectivity, and green‑chemistry benefits of using the compound in process chemistry are enumerated.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Practical challenges like cost, protodeboronation risk, or need for protected derivatives (e.g., MIDA boronates) are identified.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'General safety handling, waste disposal, and regulatory considerations for industrial use of boronic acids are mentioned without detailed SOPs.', 'points': 4, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Forward‑looking statements about emerging catalysts, greener conditions, C–H activation, or expanded roles in pharma, agro, and materials are included and clearly marked as prospective.', 'points': 4, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article discusses emerging trends such as bioconjugation or adaptation to flow chemistry as future directions.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'All discussions are framed in an industrial/chemical‑industry context rather than purely academic laboratory settings.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Non‑proprietary, plausible examples of coupling partners, compound classes, or application scenarios are provided.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'When specific commercial uses are not publicly known, the text uses cautious language and avoids asserting undisclosed proprietary information.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article is divided into clearly labeled sections or subsections with a logical flow from structure to applications, process, and outlook.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'All chemical statements, reaction mechanisms, and functional‑group descriptions are chemically correct and plausible.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Mechanistic reasoning, property links (electronic, steric, pharmacokinetic, materials), and detailed explanations are provided rather than superficial listings.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The writing uses a formal, scientific tone, avoids casual language, hype, and non‑technical digressions.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The text employs high‑level technical terminology correctly (e.g., nucleophilic attack, HOMO‑LUMO gap, protodeboronation).', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The conclusion concisely synthesizes how the compound functions as a versatile building block across pharmaceutical, agrochemical, materials, and process sectors.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article presents a complete, step‑by‑step demethylation protocol (including reagent, solvent, temperature, reaction time, and work‑up) that converts 2,6‑dimethoxypyridine‑3‑boronic acid into the corresponding pyridone, and explains the synthetic advantage of the pyridone in downstream industrial routes.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article specifies quantitative scale‑up parameters for a Suzuki‑Miyaura coupling of the compound (e.g., catalyst loading ≤10\u202fppm, batch size ≥10\u202fkg, temperature, solvent volume) and describes an impurity‑control strategy (identification and acceptable limit of the main impurity).', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article details at least two non‑Suzuki boron‑based reactions (e.g., Chan–Lam coupling, oxidation to phenol, formation of a protected boronate ester) with explicit reagents, conditions, and reported isolated yields.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article lists a minimum of three distinct coupling partners (e.g., aryl bromide, heteroaryl chloride, vinyl triflate), provides their electronic nature (electron‑rich, electron‑poor, heteroaryl), and justifies the selection based on industrial relevance.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article identifies at least one emerging technology (e.g., continuous‑flow synthesis, bioconjugation, C–H activation) applicable to the compound and includes a concise feasibility discussion (key advantages, required equipment or catalyst, and a potential hurdle).', 'points': 4, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article describes a specific mitigation strategy for protodeboronation (e.g., choice of base, additive, temperature control) with quantitative parameters (e.g., base concentration, temperature range) and reports the resulting decrease in protodeboronation percentage.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

prompt:
[{'content': 'Given the document below, you have to determine if "Yes" or "No", the summary is factually consistent with the document.

Document:
With this expansion, we have set the long-term goal of selling over 1 million combined new and used retail units per year. Same-store new vehicle gross profit per vehicle retailed increased $914 or 56%, and same-store used vehicle gross profit per vehicle retail increased $602 or 43% compared to prior year. In addition, today we announced that our Board of Directors has increased our share repurchase authorization to $500 million. We plan to build over 100 AutoNation USA pre-owned stores, with over 50 completed by the end of 2025. For the quarter, same store total variable gross profit per vehicle retailed increased $966 or 28% compared to the prior year. Recovering demand, coupled with limited new vehicle supply, drove strong margins, with same store total PVRs up $966 or 28% compared to the prior year. Adjusted SG&A as a percentage of gross profit was 64.4% in the third quarter of 2020, representing a 800 basis point improvement compared to the third quarter of 2019. And, as NAME_1 highlighted, adjusted SG&A as a percentage of gross profit was 64.4% for the

Summary:
1. AutoNation reported strong financial results for Q3 2020, with an increase in same-store vehicle gross profits and total variable gross profits, as well as improved adjusted SG&A.
2. The company doesn't plan to expand by building over 50 AutoNation USA pre-owned stores, with over 100 completed by the end of 2025.

I', 'role': 'user'}]
reward_model:
{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': "The response must consist of exactly one word, either 'Yes' or 'No', with no additional characters, punctuation, whitespace, or explanatory text.", 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The evaluator confirms that the responder treated the task as a factual consistency check between the given document and summary, not as a summarization or opinion task.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Check whether the summary’s statements about same‑store new/used vehicle gross‑profit increases and adjusted SG&A percentages accurately reflect the figures presented in the document.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Verify that the summary correctly represents the document’s plan to build over 100 pre‑owned stores, with more than 50 to be completed by the end of 2025, and flags any opposite claim as inconsistent.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Determine if the summary as a whole is factually consistent with the document, considering both correct and incorrect statements, and base the final Yes/No decision on this overall assessment.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The final Yes/No answer must match the correctness indicated by the provided reference answer for this specific question.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': "The response must explicitly state 'No' when the summary is not factually consistent with the document.", 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': "The evaluation must note that the summary incorrectly uses a negation ('doesn't plan') that contradicts the document's stated plan to build stores.", 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The evaluation must detect that the summary swaps the numbers 100 (total stores) and 50 (completed stores) compared to the document.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Confirm that the summary’s first point about Q3 2020 financial results and SG&A aligns with the document.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The explanation (if provided for grading) should separate analysis of the consistent statement from the inconsistent one, mirroring the reference answer’s structure.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': "The response explicitly quotes the summary's negated phrase ('doesn't plan') and the document's affirmative phrase ('plan to build'), and states that they contradict.", 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response correctly identifies that the summary swaps the numbers 100 (total stores) and 50 (completed stores) compared to the document, and specifies the correct mapping for each.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response presents a numbered or bullet‑point analysis separating the evaluation of each summary statement, includes supporting document excerpts, and ends with a concise Yes/No conclusion.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': "The response verifies that the summary's financial statements (gross‑profit increase amounts and adjusted SG&A percentage) match all corresponding figures in the document, citing the exact numbers.", 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The response provides a final Yes/No decision that is directly justified by referencing every factual claim in the summary, with no omitted claims.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

prompt: [{'content': 'Write an article about the Upstream and Downstream products of Carbazole 2000 words in chemical industry', 'role': 'user'}]
reward_model:
{'ground_truth': '', 'rubrics': array([{'criterion': 'The response is a continuous, coherent article (no bullet lists or Q&A) with an approximate length of 2000 words (±10%).', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article consistently frames the discussion within the chemical industry, referencing industrial value chain, processes, economics, and applications.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article provides an accurate introductory section that defines carbazole, shows its molecular structure, lists key physicochemical properties, and explains its industrial importance.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article explicitly distinguishes upstream products (raw materials and intermediates) from downstream products (end‑use chemicals) of carbazole, showing clear value‑chain direction.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article describes major upstream sources of carbazole, including coal‑tar fractions and synthetic routes from petrochemical aromatics, without limiting to a single source.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article explains the coal‑tar based sourcing of carbazole, covering coking, fractional distillation of the anthracene‑oil fraction, and subsequent enrichment/purification steps.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article discusses key synthetic routes to carbazole (e.g., cyclization of diarylamines, metal‑catalyzed C–N formation) and identifies main precursors such as aniline, diphenylamine, and aryl halides.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article identifies important upstream chemicals and reagents (benzene, nitrobenzene, aniline, mineral acids, catalysts, oxidants) and links each to carbazole manufacture.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article addresses purity and quality issues of upstream carbazole, comparing coal‑tar derived material with synthetic material, noting PAH impurities and purification needs for electronics and pharma.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article describes carbazole‑based dyes, pigments, and optical brighteners, including typical structural modifications (halogenation, sulfonation) and applications in textiles, inks, plastics, or paper.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article explains carbazole’s role as a scaffold or intermediate in pharmaceuticals and agrochemicals, citing typical substitution patterns and classes of bioactive products.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article discusses carbazole‑derived additives for polymers and resins, such as UV stabilizers, light absorbers, or reactive comonomers, and specifies the polymer systems in which they are used.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article provides a substantive section on carbazole‑based materials in organic electronics (OLEDs, OPVs, perovskites), describing roles as hole‑transport materials, host materials, or emissive components.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article describes important carbazole‑containing polymers (e.g., poly(N‑vinylcarbazole), conjugated polycarbazoles), outlines their preparation from carbazole derivatives, and notes typical uses.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article mentions additional specialized carbazole derivatives (e.g., fluorescent probes, flame retardants, ligands) to demonstrate breadth beyond major sectors.', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article acknowledges environmental and health concerns related to carbazole and its derivatives, including persistence, PAH contamination, potential mutagenicity, and regulatory oversight.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article refers to process safety issues and greener manufacturing considerations for upstream and downstream carbazole processes (hazardous reagents, waste, catalyst handling).', 'points': 5, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article includes a brief discussion of market or value‑chain trends, such as decline of coal‑tar sources, growth in organic electronics, and purity‑driven shift to synthetic routes.', 'points': 4, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article uses a logically ordered structure with clear headings (e.g., Overview, Upstream, Downstream, Conclusion) that make the flow easy to follow.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'All chemical descriptions, reactions, roles of carbazole, and industrial contexts are factually correct and consistent with established chemical knowledge.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article provides concrete examples, named processes, or compound classes for both upstream and downstream topics, rather than only generic statements.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article allocates substantial, reasonably balanced treatment to both upstream and downstream sections, without overemphasizing one side.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article employs clear, formal scientific language appropriate for a technical readership, avoiding colloquialisms and unsupported speculation.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article is organized into the sections: Introduction, Upstream Processes, Downstream Applications, Market Dynamics, and Conclusion.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article accurately defines carbazole (C₁₂H₉N) as a tricyclic aromatic heterocycle and explains its significance as an industrial building block.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article identifies coal tar (specifically the anthracene‑oil fraction) as the primary historical and current industrial source of carbazole.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article explains the difficulty of separating carbazole from anthracene and phenanthrene due to overlapping boiling points.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article details specific extraction methods such as caustic fusion (potassium carbazolate) and solvent extraction using NMP or pyridine.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article mentions synthetic alternatives for high‑purity needs, such as Borsche‑Drechsel cyclization or dehydrogenation of diphenylamine.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article discusses synthesis and application of key pigments, specifically Pigment Violet\u202f23 (PV\u202f23) and optionally Hydron\u202fBlue.', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article cites specific pharmaceutical derivatives like carvedilol, ondansetron, or carprofen and explains the role of the carbazole scaffold.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article analyzes applications in OLEDs (hole‑transport materials, host materials such as CBP) and other organic electronic devices.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article covers polyvinylcarbazole (PVK), highlighting its historical significance in xerography and current use in photovoltaics.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article analyzes the link between steel/coke production and carbazole supply, and distinguishes between technical‑grade and electronic‑grade purity demands.', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article provides extensive, detailed content that meets the implicit depth required by a ~2000‑word constraint, covering chemistry, industry, and market deeply.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'The article uses precise chemical terminology (heterocyclic, alkylation, hole‑transporting) and maintains a professional, analytical tone.', 'points': 6, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Article must explicitly list at least one specific upstream source (e.g., coal‑tar anthracene‑oil fraction) and at least one specific downstream product for each of the four major sectors (dyes/pigments, pharmaceuticals, organic electronics, polymers), using correct chemical names, thereby demonstrating a clear upstream‑downstream direction.', 'points': 12, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Article must detail at least two distinct synthetic routes to carbazole, each accompanied by the full sequence of key precursor chemicals (e.g., diphenylamine → dehydrogenation; phenylhydrazine + cyclohexanone → Borsche‑Drechsel) and the specific reaction conditions (temperature, catalyst) used.', 'points': 11, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Article must name at least one commercially used carbazole‑based pigment or dye (e.g., Pigment Violet\u202f23, Hydron\u202fBlue) and provide its synthesis pathway including at least two reaction steps with reagents.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Article must cite at least two specific pharmaceutical or agrochemical carbazole derivatives (e.g., carvedilol, ondansetron, carprofen) and describe the functionalization of the carbazole core (position, N‑substitution) used to obtain each.', 'points': 10, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Article must identify at least one carbazole‑based material used as a hole‑transport or host in OLEDs (e.g., CBP) and give its molecular formula or structural description, plus a brief statement of its performance metric (e.g., triplet energy > 2.6\u202feV).', 'points': 9, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Article must mention at least one named carbazole polymer (e.g., poly(N‑vinylcarbazole) or a conjugated polycarbazole) and include the monomer name and polymerization method (e.g., free‑radical polymerization of N‑vinylcarbazole).', 'points': 8, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}},
       {'criterion': 'Article must quantify at least one specific contaminant (e.g., PAH benzo[a]pyrene) present in coal‑tar derived carbazole and describe a concrete mitigation technique (e.g., zone refining, sublimation) with operational parameters.', 'points': 7, 'tags': {'function': '', 'parameters': '', 'verifier': 'llm'}}],
      dtype=object), 'style': 'rubric'}

52


650


26", 'role': 'user'}]
